arg1.author: hugbasulto
arg1.text: If it was the person you truly love and want to spend the rest of your life with then it's a definitely no. People make mistakes but although it's a major crime to murder someone I would still not turn in the person I love the most. If I plan on staying with that person I love for the rest of my life then I would stick with them and never turn them in. And if that means that I am part of that murder by not saying anything, well then so be it.

arg1.author: GreaterDB8R
arg1.text: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. arg1.author: cortezj
arg1.text: If my spouse committed murder I would not turn him in. I would do the exact opposite I will help him hide all evidence if any, I will move if we had to, and I will never bring it up to his attention again. If my husband killed someone, he knew what he was doing, so there or it was for a cost. It would be hard for me to turn in the one I love.

If my husband killed someone, he knew what he was doing, so there or it was for a cost. It would be hard for me to turn in the one I love.

arg1.text: If it was the person you truly love and want to spend the rest of your life with then it's a definitely no. arg1.author: GreaterDB8R
arg1.text: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? A1 and A2 take the same position for essentially the same reasons--the idea that marital vows take precedence over one spouse's crime.
A1 is more articulate and comes off as generally better written and more thought out.
A1 and A2 contain content that equally support the topic of debate.
they both say about the same things

arg1.author: rubgalvez
arg1.text: Love is much greater then any mistake. I know things happen but my wife will be able to confide in me no matter what goes wrong. I made a commitment to stay whit her through rough times and I will. Murder is a unforgivable mistake but love is not.

arg1.text: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

arg1.text: More than likely I would not turn in my spouse, because there is that love that binds us together. But on the flip side, if it was just down right cold blooded murder, yes I would turn them in.

arg1.originalHTML: I wouldn't turn my wife in because I love her and married her for a reason. I would trust my wife that she killed someone for a good reason, relatively because murder is still murder. Gene hackman killed the guy her wife was cheating with.

arg2.author: GreaterDB8R
arg2.text: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)
arg2.originalHTML:
No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership.

Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police

I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense

But Remember, when you say “I DO”, you’re basically inviting the person

You’re marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY??

If I plan on staying with that person I love for the rest of my life then I would stick with them and never turn them in. And if that means that I am part of that murder by not saying anything, well then so be it.

A “Snitch” or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,'

I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense

But Remember, when you say “I DO”, you’re basically inviting the person

You’re marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY??

If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)
